topics.body:
I figured out how to deal with my roommate:
He's one of those dudes that will always find a way out of getting in trouble; so I'm making paranoid as fuck of the cops.

What my plan is that I told the dean that he always parties at 10pm and always has minors at the parties(which he does).  He said that he's going to go out for the night instead to get away from the cops, but the reason why is I told him that the cops are coming.  I didn't tell him that I told the dean or anything; rather I told him the resident assistant wants him gone and the dean is coming for him and wants to get rid of him.  This has made him paranoid of having anymore parties at my apartment.

So his possible options are go elsewhere to party at which the cops will inspect this house at 10pm to which I can tell him, "Man the cops were all up in the place looking for you.  Dude lay low cause if they catch any booze in here you're fucked".  If he throws a party at this apartment he's going to get thrown out of school.  If he doesn't throw a party tonight he's going to see the cops and know they're eyeing him.  So even if he doesn't get arrested he's going to know the cops were here and will start getting super paranoid of them thinking that they're constantly watching the apartment or something at which point chances are I won't have to deal with anymore parties cause he's going to be paranoid to hold them here.

Tl:dr; I'm making my roommate super paranoid of the cops so that he won't have anymore parties here.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537d17c26368726841080000#post_537d17c26368726841080000

topics.body:
I know if he gets arrested again he's going to talk his way out of it; this way I can make him extremely paranoid of doing anything at this apartment.

If he parties elsewhere we'll tell him that the cops came and that they were looking for him.
If he is still here at 10pm and not partying he'll see the cops looking through all his stuff.

That should scare him enough that he'll at least go elsewhere to party.

topics.body: Why do people who live in rural areas tend to be more conservative?
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
Politics:
R.I.P. In Peace GOP.


What do I mean by this?  The latest predictions if hillary runs for president are not looking good for the republican party.  If republicans can't find a decent candidate to at least put up a fight then not only will she will Ohio, Florida and such, but she will will Texas and other republican states as well.  The problem though is that their current contenders don't stand a chance though; the problem with that is that they're going to get their ass kicked in the presidential election, but for midterms and re-election as well.

Tl:dr; Republicans are in danger of going the way of the whigs cause they have no one that remotely can go up against Hillary and stand a fighting chance.
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537d5c3a6368720af8370100#post_537d5c3a6368720af8370100
[bq="someguy111"]Why do people who live in rural areas tend to be more conservative?[/bq]
Long explanation, but the short version is that cities tend to change socially more quickly and thus tend to be more liberal.
